text: The role of social media in the spread of hate speech ~ my latest post on http://RickDunhamBlog.com
author: rickdunham

text: Another example of why it's hard to negotiate with this White House. You have to be able to trust the other side when they make an offer. China wants deal finalized before any summit because officials are afraid of one of these switcheroos.
author: rickdunham

text: Add Canada to the list of countries benefiting from the US-China trade war. (Brazil and Russia, among others, have displaced US commodity suppliers to China.) The big losers, so far: US farmers, US consumers, US manufacturers, US global image, US economy. Also Chinese economy.
author: rickdunham

text: A perceptive piece by @ShenLuLuShen, who can teach you a thing or two about gender issues in China.
author: rickdunham

text:
In comparison, Vermin Supreme, the guy who campaigned with a boot on his head, more than doubled up Gravel in 2012 with 833 Democratic primary votes.

And Rick Perry managed 1,764 in the 2012 GOP primary, a mighty 0.7% of the vote but 4+ times Gravel's total.
author: rickdunham

text: Actually, he looks more like the Chinese version of Colonel Sanders, who has been genetically modified for the Chinese market.
author: rickdunham

text: It's Goth with Chinese characteristics.
author: rickdunham

text: The only surprise here is that Elizabeth Warren is the second most bipartisan senator in the Democratic presidential field.
author: rickdunham

text: Spring has sprung on the beautiful @Tsinghua campus. Washington's cherry blossoms can't be far behind.
author: rickdunham

text: If @Facebook had paid local news outlets for some of the local news it lifted from them over the past decade – monetizing it while siphoning revenues from the local outlets – the decline in newsroom employment might not have reached 45%.
author: rickdunham

text: The @CSPAN archives are a treasure trove for journalists, students, academics and policy researchers. I often used them as DC reporter for @BW + @HoustonChron. I still use them as director of @GBJprogram. Another reason why C-SPAN is a national treasure. Let's celebrate #CSPAN40
author: rickdunham

text: Another reason to read @TheHill's Morning Report: @AlWeaver22 is there. Congrats to Al and to The Hill.
author: rickdunham

text: Good morning, America. It's been a busy day here in China. I just finished a discussion on China Radio International of U.S. probes of Boeing in the wake of the two recent plane crashes. I gave a well-earned h/t to the @WSJ for its outstanding reporting.
author: rickdunham

text: You can catch me on @CGTN_Dialogue at 7:30 a.m. ET/6:30 CT discussing the massacre in Christ Church, New Zealand, the surge in hate crimes, gun laws in the US, white supremacists, the failure of YouTube and Facebook to proactively remove hate videos, and more. A lively half-hour.
author: rickdunham

text: Yes, yes. I promise.
author: rickdunham

text: Close, Mr. Hamrick. That photo is three years after Pam and I met at a cast meeting for the Austin Gridiron Show. More like "Enchantment Under the Stars."
author: rickdunham

text: Who is that young man? I remember my first @CSPAN visit. I discussed the latest cases at #SCOTUS. That was many happy visits ago.
author: rickdunham

text: That would be a dream, @cspanSusan. I'll be back in the USA on July 10. Best wishes to all my @CSPAN friends. I miss you in 北京。
author: rickdunham

text: Thanks for the memories, Howard Mortman. This reminds me of the time Rob and I took a class together with the legendary Ian McHarg at @Penn ... and our grandfather was one of the guest lecturers. @CSPAN forever!
author: rickdunham

text: I must admit I shared the wealth with my family. Every time I would visit my grandparents (or parents, or siblings), I could drink coffee from a @CSPAN @cspanwj mug.
author: rickdunham

text: No, Stossel is looking for "the other Alan Blinder." You're the REAL @AlanBlinder.
author: rickdunham

text: Catch my brother Rob on @CSPAN tomorrow morning. C-SPAN, TV home of the Dunham family, and millions of others around the world, for 40 years. (I treasure my collection of @cspanwj mugs.) #CSPAN40
author: rickdunham

text: Britain, in the eyes of the world. (And also the view of many, if not most, people in the UK.)
author: rickdunham

text: Good to see my Central High classmate, @LewServiss, reporting on the big Mafia assassination on Staten Island for the @NYTimes. "The Godfather" came out when we were in high school and was voted "favorite movie" in our graduating class poll.
author: rickdunham

text: In my undergraduate Advanced News Writing course I just discussed the problem with antecedents. As you say, what does "it" refer to? The White House? The race? Just like Mourdock 2012 IN Senate race statement: If you get raped and become pregnant, God intended it. Intended what?
author: rickdunham

text: My @GBJprogram student Luna is completing her thesis on EU-China relations, and she needs to interview European businesspeople or people who work for European business associations. Feel free to forward this to friends and colleagues. Thanks! https://www.formtalk.net/pub.do?f=CBA6602F75EFD0E7507C42ADAB9FA8CB29CA54F5431FEC435697058C98477B32 …
author: rickdunham

text: Congrats to @AlWeaver22, one of my most talented former interns (and a top political reporter), and to @TheHill, for realizing what a valuable reporter was on the market. I look forward to seeing Al team up with @ASimendinger, a superb journalist and mentor, in the coming years.
author: rickdunham

text: One of my favorite moments on the 2000 presidential campaign trail. A nice break from the Bush vs. McCain intensity. George W, who was backstage, had a quick quip about the Bauer Backflip.
author: rickdunham

text: Tiff, is this quotation about workers in Chinese ministries or in the federal government of the United States?
author: rickdunham

text: Some people in Washington are finally discovering that these tariffs are really a tax on American consumers, not on foreign countries. Who is paying the tariff tax? All of us who buy products from washing machines to aluminum foil.
author: rickdunham

text: Do you think the American Electoral College is complicated? Israel's multi-party democracy could yield even more confusing results. The "loser" could become the "winner," or, alternatively, the game of "let's make a deal" may begin. https://www.timesofisrael.com/why-we-may-not-know-whos-won-israels-election-even-after-the-votes-are-counted/ … via @timesofisrael
author: rickdunham

text: .@SiminaMistreanu is one of my students' favorite guest speakers. Glad to see her journalism in the @WashingtonPost.
author: rickdunham

text: Matt, do you think Club for Growth is trying to elevate Beto in Iowa because they want him to be the nominee, or are they trying to take him down because they see him as a threat to Trump?
author: rickdunham

text: Wisdom for everyone from the one and only @craasch. Thanks, Chuck. https://www.stltoday.com/news/local/govt-and-politics/gateway-to-dc/raasch-why-do-we-do-this-thing-called-journalism/article_ef073cd4-f33d-59f7-a3ad-168a02d5a691.html?utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter&utm_campaign=user-share … via @stltoday
author: rickdunham

text: A lot of American political news is hard to explain to Chinese students and friends. This massage parlor owner / Mar-a-Lago access to Trump story is very easy to explain, as per @RelevantOrgans.
author: rickdunham

text: Sally Jenkins' tribute to her father Dan is one of the best columns I've read in a long time. Pam and I were so fortunate to work with the Jenkinses: me with Dan at the Dallas Times Herald, Pam with Sally at the @WashingtonPost. Good people. Great journalists. RIP Dan.
author: rickdunham

text: My wife says this is Melania without make-up. No make-up = jowls, wider face, less hair coloration.
author: rickdunham

text: This sounds absolutely un-American: Finland's leader resigns, takes blame for administration's shortcomings. “I take the responsibility for the failure. It has been a huge disappointment to me.”
author: rickdunham

text: This @Bloomberg @business headline sums up a debate I've been having with Chinese Communist colleagues for years. When I arrived in 2013, one party member claimed China's GDP would surpass the US in a year. No. Today, some are still saying "next year." Same claim in 10 years?
author: rickdunham

text: This is the lesson of Hanoi. Don't have a summit with Donald Trump unless everything is pre-negotiated. Even if it is, the last firebrands to talk to him could talk him out of it. It may have worked out for the best for America with Kim. But Xi would see it as a loss of face.
author: rickdunham

text: To @KeriBla: I assigned my advanced news writing class a package of 10 of the best enterprise stories I've collected over 40 years, and your prison denture story was the overwhelming choice for 1st place. You topped Jimmy Breslin, Pulitzer winners and me. Sincere congratulations!
author: rickdunham

text: More concerned about that #WorldSeries ring on his finger.
author: rickdunham

text: To be more precise, state-aligned media in Russia got a question, Chinese state media got a Q, Chinese Communist Party media got a Q, and Shanghai media got a Q (even if Trump didn't understand what he was saying). Calling Sputnik "state" media is like calling Fox state media.
author: rickdunham

text: This menu is the real reason Donald Trump left without lunch.
author: rickdunham

text: Beautiful writing from @PeterMarksDrama of the @WashingtonPost about the theatrics on display at the Michael Cohen hearing.  https://wapo.st/2IUjRAD?tid=ss_tw&utm_term=.a06ebe9f7abe …
author: rickdunham

text: Sounds like an announcement about moving from 1953 armistice to eventual peace treaty with North Korea and China.
author: rickdunham

text: This man is also ready to take his electric bike out on Beijing's streets at rush hour.
author: rickdunham

text: Always a good day when I see two of my most talented former interns team up on a story for @POLITICO. Go, @heatherscope and @SarahNFerris. --> Can a nice guy like Ben Ray Luján elbow his way to the top?
author: rickdunham

text: This superb data visualization tells us exactly where the 2020 election will be won. Draw an oval from Ohio to Texas, North Carolina to Pennsylvania, and you see the legitimate battlegrounds. The rest is noise. Thanks, @PollsAndVotes.
author: rickdunham

text: A remarkable likeness of Alec Baldwin.
author: rickdunham

text: This is a real collector's item. Who would have predicted you would ever have seen a Vietnamese postage stamp with American and North Korean flags in a heart shape. If stamps could only trump nukes...
author: rickdunham

text: Interested in the US role in global affairs? Here's a one-hour podcast from my CRI discussion of the Munich Security Conference with fellow academics from Germany and China. (Click on the February 22 show.) http://wap-ezfm.meldingcloud.com/schedule/detail?programId=140944&type=history&origin=ezfm …
author: rickdunham

text: I still have my copy of "The Tower Report." Far more compelling reading. Nonpartisan. Focused more on the big picture and less on salacious detail. Produced constructive suggestions for change. #MistakesWereMade
author: rickdunham

text: American newspapers aren't the only ones that need to hire some more copy editors.
author: rickdunham

text: Congratulations to Michelle @SingletaryM, an inspiration to so many people in the journalism world.
author: rickdunham

text: Imagine this: Journalists might be writing in 2300 that grandsons of Donald Trump are still living.
author: rickdunham

text: Let's hope this adds to more enterprise journalism, public accountability, government transparency and maybe a few more journalism jobs in Texas. Good luck, Fort Worth Press! http://www.fortworthbusiness.com/news/publisher-announces-launch-of-nonprofit-news-outlet-the-fort-worth/article_2acb5ae2-3147-11e9-ba3a-5780e472dada.html?utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter&utm_campaign=user-share … via @fwbusinesspress
author: rickdunham

text: I highly recommend Hainan Island for a winter trip with two kids, Derek. I'll give you a report after my upcoming trip to Cambodia, too.
author: rickdunham

text: I have repeatedly needed to confront Anti-Semitic tropes in China (Jewish money buys US political support, Jews control the US media/Hollywood). It is important for all of us to call out such invidious prejudice as it happens. Each time it happens.
author: rickdunham

text: Uh, oh. Is there something that miracle worker @HowardMortman can do to make @AGreilingKeane whole after this @CSPANwj mug mishap?
author: rickdunham

text: The Flyers drafted both Parent and Favell from the Bruins in the expansion draft. The Bruins instead bet on Gerry Cheevers (a pretty good goalie) as their goalie of the future.
author: rickdunham

text: A rare sports post: Whether you love or hate the @Flyers (and I am a Philadelphian, so guess), here's a ranking of every Flyers goalie ever. (Hint: There have been a lot of stinkers.)
author: rickdunham

text: A deeply reported piece on the Foxconn Wisconsin situation from @Bloomberg @business. A must-read for anyone interested in international business, trade, technology, China, Taiwan, U.S. politics or the legacy of Scott Walker.
author: rickdunham

text: For my reporting friends in Asia: Here's a terrific opportunity for an all-expenses-paid fellowship in Hong Kong in June on the topic of international trade. Thanks to @SandyKJohnson and the @NatPress Foundation for organizing it.
author: rickdunham

text: Is this a mis-translation, or is it painfully accurate? Either way, it points out the need for professional translators well-versed in the nuances of the English language, not unintelligent Artificial Intelligence machines.
author: rickdunham

text: This comes from one of the Democrats who has voted most often with Trump since the 2016 election.
author: rickdunham

text: Farewell (in DC) to one of @Bloomberg's best, Derek @DWallbank. We're lucky to be getting him in Asia. Another good reason to visit Singapore for a @PressClubDC reunion.
author: rickdunham

text: He does protect Pensacola.
author: rickdunham

text: The Galveston  "Seawall" takes on a whole new meaning in this latest Trump wall design.  I feel more secure knowing my in-laws will be protected by the Port Arthur Great Wall.
author: rickdunham

text: Horace Greeley was my cousin, young man.
author: rickdunham

text: Thanks for your response.  My wife contacted customer service and the problem was solved.  Thanks, @wmata.
author: rickdunham

text: Back in DC and a bad experience with @wmata. Metro fare machine at Ballston stole $20 from my wife. Attendant would not offer refund or extract bill from broken machine.  Also didn't shut down broken machine. Customer service advice, anyone?
author: rickdunham

text: Aeronautics. I wish I could say journalism, but he wants to be a pilot.
author: rickdunham

text: An insightful study by @TAMU professor Johanna Dunaway (@JLDHouston) finds that the demise of local newspapers not only polarizes civic debate, it also reduces the influence of voters in those areas. Another reason to support local journalism.
author: rickdunham

text: My nephew, Adam Dunham, is currently a Purdue undergrad.
author: rickdunham

text: Thanks to @CJDoebele, @PurdueLibArts and @CenterForCSPAN for making so much content available to the public, including my Global Business Journalism (@GBJprogram) students from around the world. Serving the American public, and global transparency.
author: rickdunham

text: Flashback to 2013: Sheila Jackson Lee's staff turnover. (I previously quantified the turnover statistics in 2011 for @TxPotomac and @HoustonChron.)
author: rickdunham

text: "The National Alliance to End Sexual Violence said it could not continue to work with Ms. Jackson Lee as the lead sponsor of legislation reauthorizing the Violence Against Women Act."
author: rickdunham

text: Congratulations to my cousin Dave for his role as COO of the new 101 Studios. This is a very impressive collection of talent creating a new global entertainment studio. https://deadline.com/2019/01/david-glasser-101-studios-300-million-ron-burkle-bob-yari-yellowstone-1202539772/ … via @deadline
author: rickdunham

text: I recently bought "Animal Farm" at a bookstore in Nanjing. No "1984" available, but you can buy the Bible.
author: rickdunham
